title: Regarding placements: DSA or Dev?
content:
Heyo!

As the new placement season is approaching, what'd you guys recommend to focus on? DSA or Development?

What do companies generally prefer in interviews & rounds? And how's the scenario of Aptitude?

Thanks!

comments.body: dsa - leetcode easy to medium..very important to crack intervies if u are aiming for T1 companies..(most of them ask for dsa)..regarding development...u can crack companies offering 10 lpa + (but it depends on luck sometimes) and which domain r u interested in
So, max companies (T1+T2) ask for DSA in most of the rounds, right?

It should be a combination of both, you need to have decent knowledge of dsa to clear coding and interview rounds. You need to have 4-5 good projects which you can put on your resume. You can never know what theyâ€™ll ask in interviews.
Not really. Interviews tend to be about your projects, expertise and the company. They will ask DSA but that's usually for one round max.
So, focusing on both and diving deep in development, too, is a must, I guess... how's the scenario of MERN in placements these days btw?

Diving deep in the subject of your liking/expertise is very good. 

Don't have too much info on MERN but I have seen plenty react dev roles.
Keep development in resume and DSA on fingertips
But if I have no tech projects in my resume... will they ask only DSA then?
wdym you have no projects? Dude you need to have 3-4 projects in your resume, what did you do in your engineering then?
I'm a fresherðŸ« ... I just wanted to know whether DSA is enough cause I'm in ECE. So along with the other projects in ECE i have to do a few Tech projects as well ryt?

Itâ€™s good if you have a few projects in hand, have one web dev, one ML based and a database based one to start with. DSA is not the only requirement, interviewer can ask anything from DSA, your core subjects(CN,OS,DBMS etc), resume related etc..
